name: excludable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
possible to exclude from something (= intentionally not include it): excludable from This sort of evidence is usually excludable from sentencing proceedings.excludable from income Contributions to these savings plans are excludable from income when working out your taxable income. Her lawyer believed that some of the information was legally excludable. Related word
exclude
More examplesFewer examplesThese services are not excludable from gross income, so you need to declare them in your tax return.Any voluntary payments you make to a retirement plan are not excludable.This permit may allow an excludable person to enter the country.
